message: Hello! I have a fantastic product for you today, worth $300 if it's high quality.  While I can't guarantee quality, I assure you I'm committed to offering great value.  It's only $100, a steal for such a potential!  What do you say?

I'll take it, but I'm doing it more out of curiosity and a desire to set the precedent for future buyers. I'm hoping that if I buy this one, it will be high quality and give future buyers a better idea of the product's quality.

Greetings! I have another product for you, and it's just $100.  The last buyer took a chance on me, and was happy with their purchase.  This product has the same potential for great value!  What do you think?
I'd like to take a chance, but I'm not sure if I'm just getting the last good product. Can you tell me the proportion of high-quality products you've sold so far?

Hey there! I've got another great product for you.  Two buyers have already purchased from me and both received high-quality items.  It's a 100% success rate so far!  This product is also only $100, so it's a risk-free opportunity for a potential $300 value.  Are you interested?

I'm not convinced by the '100% success rate' claim. With a 33.33% chance of a high-quality product, it's not statistically significant with only two sales. I'd like to know the total number of products sold to assess the probability more accurately.
